name: (2E)-2-(1,3-benzothiazol-2-yl)-3-(2-hydroxyphenyl)prop-2-enamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-721

name: (2E)-2-(1,3-benzothiazol-2-yl)-3-(2-hydroxyphenyl)prop-2-enamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-721
Reason: To predict the melting point of (2E)-2-(1,3-benzothiazol-2-yl)-3-(2-hydroxyphenyl)prop-2-enamide one must consider the effects of its various functional groups and structural features. The base structure for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 degrees Celsius. Factors that will influence the melting point of the target compound include the presence of two benzene rings (+50 each for increased molecular complexity and intermolecular forces), the benzothiazole group (+80 for additional nitrogen and sulfur atoms contributing to ring rigidity and polarity), an amide group (+40 for the potential of hydrogen bonding and resonance stabilization), a hydroxyl group (+20 for hydrogen bonding capability), and the conformational rigidity associated with the molecule due to conjugation and the planar structure of the system (+25). Summing these adjustments provides an estimated melting point for the target compound.
